executive_summary: Sanket Gaikwad is a 43-year-old male with Type 1 Diabetes Mellitus, presenting with an HbA1c of 8.4%, indicating poor glycemic control. His blood pressure is slightly elevated at 134/95 mmHg, and he is classified as overweight with a BMI of 27.8. Immediate focus should be on improving glycemic control and managing cardiovascular risk factors.

priority_actions: Consider medication for blood pressure and lipid management

clinical_context.recent_events: No recent episodes of hypoglycemia or DKA

labs_table.comment: Above target, indicating poor glycemic control

interpretation.assessment: HbA1c of 8.4% indicates inadequate diabetes management.
interpretation.plan: Consider starting insulin therapy and diabetes education.
Monitor and consider antihypertensive medication if lifestyle changes are insufficient.

interpretation.assessment: LDL level is significantly above target.
interpretation.plan: Initiate statin therapy and dietary modifications.

lifestyle_plan.text: Encourage regular physical activity, aiming for at least 150 minutes of moderate exercise per week.
Advise reducing alcohol intake to no more than 14 units per week.

diet_plan.principles: Focus on a balanced diet rich in whole grains, fruits, vegetables, lean proteins, and healthy fats.
sample_meals: Breakfast: Oatmeal with berries and nuts
Lunch: Grilled chicken salad with mixed greens
Dinner: Baked salmon with quinoa and steamed broccoli
diet_plan.portion_guidance: Use portion control to manage calorie intake and maintain a healthy weight.

monitoring_plan.glucose_targets: Aim for pre-meal glucose levels of 4-7 mmol/L.
monitoring_plan.testing_frequency: Test blood glucose at least 4 times a day.
monitoring_plan.safety_checks: Regularly check for signs of hypoglycemia and monitor blood pressure weekly.

patient_goals: Reduce blood pressure to < 135/85 mmHg within 3 months
Lower LDL cholesterol to < 2.0 mmol/L within 6 months
Engage in physical activity at least 5 days a week

medication_plan.text: Consider starting insulin therapy for diabetes management.
Initiate statin therapy for high LDL cholesterol.
Consider antihypertensive medication if lifestyle changes do not improve blood pressure.

follow_up.actions: Review blood glucose logs, assess medication adherence, and adjust treatment as necessary.
Reassess HbA1c, blood pressure, and lipid levels.

emr_note: Patient is a 43-year-old male with T1DM, presenting with HbA1c of 8.4%, elevated BP, and high LDL. Recommendations include initiating insulin therapy, lifestyle modifications, and regular monitoring.
